name: /Lotus/Language/Relayreconstruction/Relayreconphase1leftitemname
description: With a blazing orange hue and rigid material strength, this compound is prized by ship and station architects.

name: /Lotus/Language/Relayreconstruction/Relayreconphase3leftitemname
description: With a blazing orange hue and rigid material strength, this compound is prized by ship and station architects.

name: Amarast
description: A violet gem that forms from the crystallization of byproducts expelled from the Weeping Towers.

patchlogs.name: Fortuna: Update 24.0
patchlogs.changes: Amarast

name: Asterite
description: Formed over billions of years, these crystals are most often found embedded in space rock.

patchlogs.name: Empyrean: Ivara Prime 27.0.9
patchlogs.changes:
Asterite Resource pickups now reward 2x as much Asterite. 
Asterite costs for Wreckage were going a bit too slowly, so now you will earn it at twice the rate.

patchlogs.name: Empyrean: Update 27
patchlogs.fixes: Asterite

name: Atmo Systems
description: A modular component that compensates for the multitude of atmospheric conditions encountered in the Origin System.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 25.4.1 + 25.4.1.1
patchlogs.changes: Increased Atmo Systems drop by 1 quantity (from 4 to 5) across the board for the Profit-Taker Heists rewards to slightly reduce friction in ranking up in Fortuna.

patchlogs.name: Fortuna: Hotfix 24.2.9 + 24.2.9.1
patchlogs.changes: Atmo Systems (2500 Standing)

name: Aucrux Capacitors
description: Once installed, these delicate power systems fuse with a Corpus Obelisk’s engines. Unused capacitors are therefore, highly prized.

patchlogs.name: Empyrean: Update 27
patchlogs.fixes: Aucrux Capacitors

description: A brilliant, dense and conductive metal.Location: Plains of Eidolon

name: Azurite

patchlogs.name: Plains of Eidolon: Hotfix 22.0.5
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Pyrol and Azurite being rarer than intended and Coprun and Devar being more likely than intended. They should now be equally as likely.

name: Bracoid
description: A rare bacterial entity that increases the spread of Infestation found on Infested Ships.

patchlogs.name: Empyrean: Update 27
patchlogs.fixes: Bracoid

name: Calda Toroid
description: A device of undetermined function and origin. Prized by Vox Solaris and the Quills.

patchlogs.name: Plains of Eidolon Remaster: Hotfix 24.7.2
patchlogs.changes: Calda Toroids have a 20% chance to drop from Scyto Raknoids.

patchlogs.name: Fortuna: Update 24.0
patchlogs.changes: All Enrichment Labs enemies have a chance to drop the Calda Toroid.

name: Carbides
description: Resilient components used to reinforce the plated sheets of metal strapped to Grineer Ships.Location: Ceres

patchlogs.name: Empyrean: Ivara Prime 27.0.5
patchlogs.changes: Removed Resource collection sound for all items except: Carbides, Copernics, Cubic Diodes and Pustrels due to a constant stream of that specific sound because it happens for every single pickup. Sound is now reserved for important Forging Resources!

patchlogs.name: Rising Tide: Update 26.1
patchlogs.changes: Carbides = Eximus units on *Ceres Shipyard tileset

name: Cerulean Fungus Extract
description: Extracted from a Cerulean Fungus colony.

name: Cetus Wisp
description: Strange stone lifeforms that call the Plains home. They are a rare find, clustering together, floating above a patch of ground they've taken an inexplicable interest in. They are an enigma.Location: Plains of Eidolon

patchlogs.name: Plains of Eidolon Remaster: Hotfix 24.7.2
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed the Cena Apparel Blueprint and Vahd Apparel Blueprint requiring 5 Cetus Wisps by swapping it to 5 Eidolon Gems.

patchlogs.name: Fortuna: Hotfix 24.2.7 + 24.2.7.1
patchlogs.changes: Reduced the Standing cost of Cetus Wisps from 10k to 5k.

patchlogs.name: Fortuna: The Profit-Taker - Update 24.2
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Toroids and Cetus Wisps disappearing over-time if enough other pickups drop.

patchlogs.name: The Sacrifice: Update 23
patchlogs.changes: Moved Cetus Wisp and Maprico Tree spawn points a bit further away from water volumes in the NW corner of the Plains for gathering ease.

patchlogs.name: Beasts of the Sanctuary: Hotfix 22.18.7
patchlogs.changes: Quill Onkko has added a Cetus Wisp to his Offerings in Cetus. These can be purchased with Quill Standing for Architect level Tenno.

patchlogs.name: Shrine of the Eidolon: Update 22.16.0
patchlogs.changes: A special UI message is now displayed when picking up a Syndicate Medallion or Cetus Wisp (similar to Argon Crystal).

patchlogs.name: Shrine of the Eidolon: Hotfix 22.13.4
patchlogs.changes: Picking up a Cetus Wisp will now display the same special UI message like when you pick up an Argon Crystal.

patchlogs.name: Plains of Eidolon: Update 22.10.0
patchlogs.changes: Ghoul Bounty tables have received new items including Nitain, Cetus Wisps, and Breath of the Eidolon!

patchlogs.name: Plains of Eidolon: Hotfix 22.8.3
patchlogs.changes: More than doubled the size of the Cetus Wisp pickup radius. This will allow you to obtain the Cetus Wisp from further away instead of needing to be right on top of it.
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Cetus Wisps being updated while the game was paused -

patchlogs.changes: Picking up a Syndicate Medallion, Exceptional Sentient Core, or Flawless Sentient Core will now display the same special UI message like when you pick up an Argon Crystal.

patchlogs.name: Plains of Eidolon: Update 22.10.0
patchlogs.additions: Added a reusable Blueprint for converting Intact Sentient Cores to Exceptional Sentient Cores. This Blueprint is available from Onkko in Cetus. This is an addition to help provide an alternative, but still invested, way for players to progress in the Quills.

patchlogs.name: Plains of Eidolon: Hotfix 22.0.3
patchlogs.changes: Increased Exceptional Sentient Cores from 400 Standing to 500 Standing.

patchlogs.name: Fortuna: Hotfix 24.0.5
patchlogs.changes:
Reduced the Fieldron crafting requirements for the Kreska, Ocucor, and Battacor from 20 to 10.
A script is in the works and will be run tomorrow to refund Fieldron to those who have already crafted

patchlogs.name: Specters of the Rail: Hotfix 13
patchlogs.changes: Detonite/Fieldron rewards from Invasion missions will now always be a bundle of 3.

patchlogs.name: Update: Specters of the Rail
patchlogs.changes: Fieldron Sample replaced with Fieldron

patchlogs.name: Mesa Update
patchlogs.changes: Increased Outbreak rewards on ‘Hard’ Planets: Doubled the offered rewards (i.e 2x Fieldron, etc).

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 14.0.9
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed issue where the Dual Cestra project can be started before you ever start the Fieldron research. Every other item in the energy lab has prior requirements except for Dual Cestras.

description: This destroyed Fieldron could further research into super-heated containment fields.Locations: Venus, Mars, Jupiter, Europa, Neptune, and Pluto.

patchlogs.changes: The Quills Standing increases (Flawless Sentient Cores remains the same for now):
